**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Sales Specialist – Sustainability
description:
Are you ready to simplify supplier sustainability due diligence and drive impactful change? At Stratsys we offer a SaaS platform that streamlines compliance in business-critical areas such as sustainability, GRC, and quality work for medium to large organizations. Unlike other compliance tools we are focused not only on identifying potential and actual risks but also on mitigating them and providing data and statistics to reporting frameworks such as the CSRD. We are now looking for a Sales Specialist to join our Product Sales Sustainability team in Stockholm.
 



 This is a role where you guide customers and prospects to find the right critical tools for their sustainability work, making a real difference in a rapidly growing area. We have recently acquired a software company that supports supplier assessments, further enhancing our capabilities in this field. Screening suppliers is a complex and time-consuming task, tangled in legal obligations and frameworks like CSRD/ESRS & CSDDD. But fear not! Our tool is designed to streamline this process, empowering customers to efficiently identify and mitigate sustainability risks in their supply chains as well as reporting the results.
 



  





**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? 💡** 



* You will be a part of a high-energy and familiar culture where colleagues become friends. Take a look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Work from a fantastic and central office.
* Maximum wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 and a company that encourages exercise and movement.
* We offer our employees a hybrid solution as well as flexible working hours.
* Work in a really important area with significant potential and strong market demand. The sustainability field is a growth area for us, with a well-developed pipeline and a lot of marketing support.



  





**About The Role 📌** 




 In this position, you will be responsible for sales of our sustainability products towards new and existing customers primarily in the private sector. This includes managing the entire sales process from the first meeting with potential customers until you have found the right offer and concluded a final agreement.
 



  





**Amongst other tasks - the responsibilities include;** 



* Engage with potential customers, building relationships and creating awareness and interest in our products through meetings and dialogue with senior decision-makers.
* Expand and maintain a strong network within the product area and Sustainability field.
* Provide expert advice and business development support to customers throughout the purchase process.
* Proactive prospecting and outreach to fill our leads pipeline, as well as responsibility for budget, pipeline, and forecast in our sales process.
* Manage agreements with new customers.
* Collaborate with other internal contact points to deliver the best value to customers.
* Be a specialist in our sustainability product and act as a reliable internal and external advisor in the product area.



  





 We love to create value for our customers and meet them where they are, which means that Inbound Marketing, Social Selling, and events are important to us. We use Hubspot as our CRM system and invest heavily in digital sales and marketing events. The role offers great opportunities and freedom to build your own business!
 



  





**YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️** 



* University degree in Business Administration, Sustainability Management, or similar.
* 2+ years of experience in the sustainability field (e.g., Supplier Due Diligence & Sustainability Reporting).
* Previous sales experience, preferably in SaaS.
* Interest in digitalization and technical systems.
* Fluent in Swedish and good knowledge of English (Norwegian is a bonus).



**It's a bonus if you have…** 



* Experience in climate calculations, software, or digitalization within sustainability.
* Familiarity with CSRD, CSDDD, GHG, and ESG factors.
* Experience with Hubspot or similar CRM systems is a plus.



  





**About You 👀** 




 You are passionate about sustainability but at the same time pragmatic, understanding the challenges that companies and organizations face in this field. To thrive in this role, you appeal to an environment with an entrepreneurial spirit. You have a genuine interest in both digitalization and business management. Delivering results towards ambitious goals is familiar to you. Additionally, you value teamwork and seek to be part of a company culture where success is shared and collaboration is key. You bring personal maturity and confidence in engaging with decision-makers, alongside a proactive approach to learning and sharing knowledge with others. Your fearless, positive attitude and ability to collaborate efficiently make you a great fit for our sales-driven organization.
 



  





**About Us 🚀** 




 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with the selection of candidates.
 



 Is this particular role not quite right for you - Show your interest by connecting with us. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook.

title: Key Account Manager – Rituals Nordics Wholesale
description:
Wholesale & Travel Retail ser till att våra återförsäljare alltid har vårt varumärke i åtanke. Bland våra återförsäljare finns allt från berömda varuhus till flygplatsbutiker.
   

  

 Dela din talang
   

  

 Rituals is now seeking a Key Account Manager for the Wholesale department in the Nordics. You will work with key customers to strengthen partnerships and contribute to Rituals growth. It's an exciting role with both international and Nordic focus in a growing company that always strives to be a leader and challenger in the industry.
   

  

 YOUR ROLE
   

  

 As a Key Account Manager for Rituals Wholesale, you are responsible for ensuring that our sales goals are achieved both on a Nordic and global level. You develop and manage our key customers in the perfumery industry by creating tailored solutions based on market analysis and customer needs. Together with your team, you evaluate and implement strategic plans and ensure that initiatives from Rituals headquarter in Amsterdam are followed in the Nordics. You also have a leadership role where you coach and develop your team, while acting as a brand ambassador towards our customers. You report to the Head of Wholesale Nordics and currently have responsibility for a coordinator in the Nordic Wholesale team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and implement business plans for your accounts.
* Act as the main contact for customers regarding assortment and category work.
* Negotiate and update partnership agreements for each account.
* Analyze data and KPIs to assess results.
* Ensure budget and profitability goals are met.


 Är du den vi söker?
   

  

 In this role, we are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 3 years of experience in relationship-focused sales.
* 2-3 years of experience in a leadership role.
* Preferable experience in the cosmetics industry or e-commerce.
* University degree in a relevant field.
* Excellent computer skills and experience with PowerPoint presentations.
* Fluent in English and Swedish, other Nordic languages are a plus.


**Desired Qualities For This Role**
* Business-oriented and sales-driven.
* Good analytical skills with a focus on the big picture.
* Confident leader who builds trust with employees and customers.
* Solution-oriented with experience in negotiations at a central level.
* Positive energy, accuracy, and relationship orientation.
* Striving to be "best in class" and create meaningful customer experiences.


**What We Offer**
 We offer you a full-time position at our Nordic headquarters located on Biblioteksgatan in central Stockholm. Rituals' philosophy is based on
 *Slow down... and turning the small moments in life into meaningful Rituals* 
 , and that's exactly the experience we all work to provide our customers. Rituals is passionate about sustainable and personal well-being in the beauty industry, and with us, you will drive your area towards high, challenging, and fun business goals while having the opportunity to develop, prioritize your well-being, and be part of an amazing journey.
   

  

 OUR RITUALS
   

  

 "
 *We are not here to sell beauty, we are here to make you feel good!* 
 " Raymond Cloosterman, CEO Rituals.
   

  

 Rituals wants to help you slow down in your busy life, create meaningful moments, and remind you to experience these moments with joy.
   

  

 INTERESTED?
   

  

 If interested, please apply via our recruitment system. Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis. For further questions, contact recruitment.nordics@rituals.com. We only accept applications via our recruitment system to ensure proper data processing according to GDPR. Applications via email will not be considered.
   

  

*To ensure that your personal data is processed correctly, we only accept applications via our recruitment system. Applications via email will not be included in our selection process due to GDPR procedures.*
 Fördelar med att jobba på Rituals
   

  

* Kontinuerlig utbildning och utvecklingsprogram
* Årlig bonus baserat på bolagets uppnådda resultat
* 30% rabatt i butik och online
* Friskvårdsbidrag via Epassi
* Firande och wellbeing initiativ

title: Finsktalande kundservicemedarbetare Heltid/Skift (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Om tjänsten**
 Som finsktalande kundtjänstmedarbetare på Tietoevry Banking kommer du arbeta självständigt med att ta emot inkommande samtal och ge kunden service av högsta kvalitet. Den störtsta delen av dina uppgifter är inom finansiella tjänster och supporing av bankens slutkunder exempelvis spärr av bankkort etc. Ditt arbete utförs på såväl finska som svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Denna tjänst erbjuder dig att få möjligheten att jobba med ett fantastiskt team på 8 personer där ett gott samarbete & trivsel värderas starkt. Vi är bemannade dygnet runt, vilket innebär att skift pass förekommer på dagtid, kvällstid & nattetid + helger.
   

  

 Antällningsform: Tillsvidare - heltidstjänst
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Ta emot inkommande samtal från kunder, främst privatpersoner men också butiker och bankpersonal och hjälpa dem igenom sitt ärende
* Utringning på inkomna ärenden
* Registrera alla inkommande ärenden i diverse system
* Lösa inkommande ärenden utifrån situation
* Ge service & bemötande på topp nivå gentemot våra kunder bästa lösningen utifrån situation
* Arbeta för att skapa och utveckla goda samarbeten mot företagets kunder


**Kvalifikationer** 
**/ Vi söker dig som**
* Talar och skriver finska, svenska och engelska obehindrat
* Har tidigare erfarenhet från en roll innehållande kundservice där du bemött privatpersoner, via exempelvis telefon, butik, restaurang etc
* Har en gymnasieexamen
* Är Serviceminded
* Har god datorvana


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Då vi erbjuder support dygnet runt söker dig som är flexibel, lojal & lösningsorienterad. Du får gärna vara ansvarstagande och strukturerad i ditt arbetssätt & kan bemöta kunden på ett professionelt sätt i alla lägen. Dessutom är du noggrann i ditt arbete för att alltid kunna säkerställa att du levererar högsta kvalitet av service till kunden. Vidare kan det finnas perioder av högre arbetsbelastning och vi ser därför att du kan hantera stressiga situationer och har det lätt för att kommunicera med kollegor. Vi lägger störst vikt vid de personliga egenskaperna.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder dig en spännande tjänst i en av nordens största IT-företag som växer både nationellt och internationellt. Vi arbetar i en professionell miljö som kommer att ge dig chansen till utveckling och växt genom att ta del av spännande utmaningar & kunskap. I dagsläget tillhandahåller vi en hybrid arbetsmodell med två fasta dagar i veckan i våra nya & fina lokaler i Solna.
   

  

**Fick vi dig inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, Jonna Winqvist, jonna.winqvist@tietoevry.com
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

 Plats: Stockholm - Solna
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
*Tietoevry värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande av alla kön, åldrar, förmågor, etniciteter, inriktningar, övertygelser och bakgrunder.*
**Om Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry skapar målmedveten teknik som återuppfinner världen för gott. Vi är ett ledande teknikföretag med ett starkt nordiskt arv och global kapacitet. Utifrån våra kärnvärderingar öppenhet, tillit och mångfald, arbetar vi med våra kunder för att utveckla digitala framtider där företag, samhällen och mänskligheten frodas.
   

  

 Våra 24 000 experter globalt är specialiserade på moln, data samt mjukvara och bistår tusentals företagskunder och offentliga kunder i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevrys årliga omsättning är cirka 3 miljarder euro och bolagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs. Bekanta dig med vad vi gör.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Cloud Network Architect / Engineer till IT avdelningen i Stockholm
description:
****Brinner du för nätverk och cloud? Vill du arbeta i en händelserik miljö och vara med och utforma framtiden inom nätverk? Då vill vi höra från dig!****
****Vi vill satsa på området och söker därför flera personer till vårt Cloud Infrastructure Team.****
**Om tjänsten**
 Som Cloud Network Architect/Engineer kommer du att vara med och driva arbetet inom nätverk framåt, Ving befinner sig i en stor transformationsresa in i molnet och här blir du en viktig del. I rollen kommer du att ha en framåtblick och omvärldsbevaka ny teknik samtidigt som du arbetar hands-on med allt från att implementera lösningar till att supportera utvecklingsteam gällande nätverksfrågor.
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i teamet Technology Services som ansvarar för ett modernt private cloud-datacenter byggt på Microsoft-teknologi, Azure public cloud-lösningar med tyngden på SaaS och PaaS lösningar. Teamet strävar efter att ständigt förbättras och du kommer ges stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Som Cloud Network Architect/Engineer kommer du att arbeta med att ta fram och driva roadmap för nätverk samt implementera och underhålla lösningar i både Azure och Onprem miljöer. Detta kommer bland annat innebära att:
   

  

  

* Designa, standardisera, underhålla och leverera nätverks plattformar i molnet och on-prem
* Vara drivande i arbetet inom arktiektur och roadmap för nätverk och i vår molnresa
* Samarbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team för att anpassa nätverkslösningar utifrån verksamhetens behov.
* Felsökning och problemlösning av tjänster och implementering av nya lösningar
* Guida och supportera verksamhet och utvecklingsteam i nätverksrelaterade frågor


**Vem vi söker** 
**Vi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:**
* Högskoleutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom IT fokuserade på molnlösningar och arkitektur, företrädesvis med Microsoft Azure
* Kunskap om Microsofts teknologistack för både privata och offentliga molntjänster
* Kunskap inom Azure Networking, Data centre network, SD-WAN, Network Security


**Det är meriterande om du även:**
* Är certifierad inom IT arkitektur (ex. TOGAF, COBIT)
* Har kunskap inom Infrastructure as Code (IaC), ARM/Bicep, automatisering
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt


 Vi söker dig som har sinne för struktur, är noggrann och analytisk. Du tar självständiga initiativ och är en analytisk problemlösare som har förmågan att se saker ur ett helhetsperspektiv och förstå samband mellan detalj och helhet. Du är bra på problemlösning och har lätt att knyta relationer för goda samarbeten. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

****Vi erbjuder****
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

****Ansökan****
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Urval sker löpande, så vi välkomnar din ansökan så snart som möjligt. I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Ving med Boxhill AB. Vill du veta mer, kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Petra Törnblom, petra.tornblom@bhill.se
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 IT
   

  

 Roll: Technology Services
   

  

 Platser: Stockholm
   

  

 Distansarbete: Hybridarbete
   

  

 Anställningsform: Heltid
   

  

 Startdatum
   

  

 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Henrik Eriksson, henrik.eriksson@nltg.com Skicka ansökan

title: The Real Deal Marketing Internship (Content & SoMe)
description:
**SoMe & Content Marketing Internship**
*Part-time, Stockholm*
 Are you a creative content wiz ready to join a true impact start-up and brand? Then we have a catch for you! Hooked Foods is developing plant-based proteins with the mission to lead the transition to a healthier planet. We are now looking for one SoMe & Content Marketing Intern to join us in spreading the word about Hooked!
   

  

**The Role**
 As Content Marketing Intern at Hooked Foods you are responsible for all content creation for social media and will be given freedom to use your creativity. We believe this role is perfect to do alongside university studies and we offer flexibility in terms of working hours and format. Ideally you work minimum 2 days a week which can be in our office in Stockholm or remote. You will work closely with the founders and leaders of Hooked. You will be joining a creative, fast-moving and passionate environment with great opportunities to learn and develop.
   

  

 Your main responsibilities will be, but not be limited to:
   

  

* Create engaging content for social media (Instagram & Tiktok)
* Communicate with followers and fans to understand their profile and drivers
* Manage Social Media strategy to maximize reach and engagement


**Who You Are**
 In order for you to succeed in this role we believe you have:
   

  

* Creative content creator who has an artistic eye and passion for food & storytelling
* Experience working with social media and content creation
* Other occupation, eg. studies to combine with the internship.
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish, both verbal and written.


 Personality and a good cultural fit are as important as hard skills. As a key member of the Hooked-crew it’s therefore important that you truly believe in Hooked’s mission and feel excited to actively live our brand! Check our values here and see if these resonate with you: https://rb.gy/mculh0
   

  

**Why you should join us**
 We offer you the unique opportunity to use your skills to make a true impact, as healthy sustainable alternative protein are needed more urgently than ever. You will work in an inspiring fast-paced environment together with other ambitious and purpose-driven people. We will entrust you with 100% ownership and to be a core part of making Hooked the best plant-based protein company out there. The internship is unpaid but we will offer you an unforgetable experience and responsibility you cannot find anywhere else. A true springboard for your carreer. Given a successful internship there is an opportunity to join us full time as Marketing Manager. If you like to challenge yourself and feel excited to join us on this exciting journey, this is the position you are looking for.
   

  

**Are you Hooked yet?**
 Would you like to get on-board the Hooked-ship and accelerate the new generation of seafood to save our oceans? Great, then send in your application no later than the
 **1st of September.**
 The recruitment process is ongoing and we will be interviewing candidates continuously, therefore the position might be filled before the last application date. So do not wait too long to apply!

title: Technical Engineer
description:
**Role:**

  

* Configure and install various network devices and services (e.g., routers, switches, load balancers, VPN, QoS)
* Perform network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, hot fixes and security configurations
* Traffic Engineer usage and monitor performance and ensure system availability and reliability
* Monitor system resource utilization, trending, and capacity planning
* Provide Level-3 support and troubleshooting in cooperation with operations team to resolve issues
* Work within established configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure
* Select and implement policies, and procedures in conjunction with the company’s security team
* Develop, build and manage (DevOps) Network Architected solutions for H&M Group globally (e.g., routing, switching, SD-WAN, ACI Data Centre Environment)
* Participate in assessing existing implementations, designing future state, and building transition plans for implementation of network infrastructure features.
* Being an advisor in designing, planning and implementing Network Infrastructure projects in the respective technology area
* Assist with advice for high priority incidents.
* Cooperate and coordinate with stakeholders within business, security, services and network related products/areas
* Contribute to the Unit and Product Area strategy and OKRs
* Be responsible to keep our production Network Design setups documented and ensure that the required knowledge is available for other product teams
* Take ownership and end to end responsibility for the solutions/functions within product team
* Constant improvement of the solutions (automation, upgrades, LCM, etc.)
* Follow all Service Management Processes including but not limited to Change, Configuration, Problem and Incident Management Processes
* Striving for cost efficiency and automation based on trends and new technologies for Network solutions during our journey towards the Cloud based solutions
* Provide technical engineering and best practices concerning the overall design of the organization’s network infrastructure
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, making recommendations as needed to help our company develop and deliver cloud future state architectures and roadmaps

**Essential requirements:**

  

* Deep understanding and experience in IP Networking
* Network foundations (LAN, WAN, DNS, NAT, VPN, routing)
* Deep understanding of networking protocols (e.g., IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, QoS)
* Hands-on experience with monitoring, network diagnostic and network analytics tools
* Expertise in Cloud networking
* Ability of network troubleshooting (pcap, Wireshark, NetFlow)
* Experience and understanding of developing with DevOps methodology

**Meritorious:**

  

* Proven hands-on network engineering experience
* CCNP or higher (CCIE and/or CISSP highly valued)
* Solid understanding of the OSI or TCP/IP model
* University degree in Computer Science or a related subject
* Basic understanding of Agile methodology and tools used (Jira/Confluence)
* Understanding or experience within Azure cloud
* Scripting, programming experience (e.g. Python)
* At least basic knowledge or experience of ServiceNow
* Network automation experience
* Experience in network as a code concept
* Experience and understanding of Network Security products (IPS, proxy, firewall, reverse-proxy, load balancing)

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Stockholm  

**Period**: 23-09-2024-08-09-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 22-08-2024  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Configuration manager, Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Configuration Manager- Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)**
 Do you have a strong technical background, passion for problem-solving and want to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!
   

  

 We are looking for a Configuration Manager who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking delivers scalable and modular Banking as a Service and leading software built by unmatched industry expertise, accelerating the digital transformation of financial institutions.
   

  

**When joining** 
**Tietoevry Banking as a Configuration manager:**
* You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve infrastructure and deployment issues
* You will set up and maintain Azure DevOps pipelines for continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD)
* You will develop and maintain scripts and tools to automate the deployment and management of software applications
* You will play an important role in designing new innovative services based on future business trends and needs


**Who we are looking for:**
* You have an academic degree in technology or similar
* You have expertise in Azure DevOps and TFS
* You have strong knowledge of CI/CD concepts and tools
* You are enthusiastic, self-driven and motivated by technical development and implementation
* You are fluent in English, both verbally and in writing


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from, and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.
   

  

**We also believe you have:**
* You have experience of being a strong operative team leader
* Worked with Microsoft Azure
* Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IAC) i.e Terraform


**We offer**
 We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing, fast-developing and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Anders Nilsson, anders.f.nilsson@tietoevry.com

With a unique combination of global capabilities and local presence, Tietoevry currently serves customers in more than 90 countries around the world - creating a digital advantage for millions every day. Are you ready to make an impact?**
 Tietoevry Banking helps the Nordic Wealth industry thrive by providing leading core business solutions to a large number of players in the market. We have a strong growth agenda and are now looking to strengthen our team in the Stockholm region.
   

  

 With us you will work within the unit Equities, Funds & Savings Sweden, within our Wealth division, you will be a part of a growing business within the Nordic market for equities trading, funds distribution and safekeeping of equities and funds.
   

  

 In a nutshell, in our team you get to:
   

  

* Grow and nurture a personal network within the Wealth industry
* Create new relationships for our Wealth business
* Help customers transform their businesses and thrive, through the benefits of our leading software-based business platforms
* Work closely with the best expertise in the market

 If you in addition are willing to grow within some of these areas, it's meritorious:
   

  

* Software design / architecture
* Workflow management and CI/CD

 You will work in an agile environment using scrum, sprints, CI/CD targeting a DevOps organisation and way of working.
   

  

 Our stack includes .NET using C#, web development with Angular and ASP.NET, as well as windows-based applications using SQL server and T-SQL. The target for the whole portfolio is an event driven micro-service architecture. Previous experience of Azure is extra meriting.
   

  

 We work according to a hybrid model where you are expected to be at the office at least 2 days per week.
   

  

 To succeed in above roles, you should have:
   

  

* Strong development skills using various technologies, preferably in an enterprise environment.
* Strong communication skills, written and verbal, including in English and Swedish.
* Great people skills
* Experience in working independently as well with teams

title: Data Platform Engineer | Shared Tech
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We’re looking for a self-starting and enthusiastic Data Platform Engineer with a focus on data platforms and tooling to join our team.
   

  

 With over 16 Petabytes of data and over 130 billion events generated every day, data at King is at the heart of the business. The Data & ML organisation at King - split across Barcelona, London and Stockholm - is responsible for ingesting and processing all the data we receive each day and to use it to drive all of King's data, analytics and machine learning needs.
   

  

 You will be part of the
 *Data Foundations* 
 team, in charge of providing data products and services used by the whole company. You’ll take ownership and accountability of projects, spot opportunities for technical and platform improvements, and drive our data systems to the next level.
   

  

****Your role within our Kingdom****
* You will work in a highly collaborative team to devise solutions to data systems, tooling and engineering problems, bringing your skills and ideas into every discussion.
* Develop, operate and maintain components of our data platform including our Airflow based orchestration platform and framework (450k tasks per week), our data catalog and our proprietary data notification system built with python, GCP pub/sub and GCP datastore.
* You’ll take ownership and responsibility for the quality of the solutions, testing them and ensuring best practices are used throughout the development process - particularly with regard to self-explanatory code, maintainability, cost efficiency and scalability.
* You’ll learn new technical skills when needed and use them to help the team achieve success.
* Use your expertise in Python to build out our Airflow framework, enhance our data notification system and contribute to the wider python community and ecosystem.
* You will collaborate with other teams within the Shared Tech organisation to ensure the consistent and coherent growth of our collective data capabilities.
* You will engage directly with our stakeholders to understand the way they work and their problems.
* Champion data literacy and engineering best practice with our stakeholders and wider cross functional teams, and share your knowledge with King’s Data Engineering craft.


****Skills to create thrills****
* Expertise in Python, including application frameworks (Flask, FastAPI), pytest, TDD, API design and pydantic.
* In-depth knowledge of Airflow components, architecture, and best practices in DAG development, including advanced topics like DAG factories.
* Proven experience with GCP, AWS or Azure.
* Experience working with Terraform, and CI/CD pipelines.
* Familiarity with BigQuery or similar cloud DWH platforms such as Snowflake or AWS Redshift.


****Bonus skills:****
* SQL and data modeling.
* Exposure to Kubernetes, Helm, Docker.
* BI tools such as Looker/PowerBI/etc.
* GCP based services such as cloud run, datastore, dataflow, cloud functions and pub/sub.
* ML Ops knowledge and grasp of basic concepts.


**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Consultant Sales Manager
description:

- **We Offer:**

title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
- We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.


With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.


Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories

  
**Day-to-day life**

* Implement specific GCP-solutions for our clients, build and expand infrastructures, write infrastructure-as-code and execute seamless migrations from on-prem setups
* Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions
* Contribute to pre-sales and help train teammates and solve complex problems
* Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes and Terraform and continue to develop your expertise
* Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions

Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


  
You're passionate about the cloud and love to learn and explore its ever-evolving possibilities. As a senior team member, you're a self-starter who can manage your workload and drive projects forward, while enjoying the collaborative energy of our team. You're client-focused, able to understand their needs, translate them into technical solutions, and deliver presentations that resonate with your audience.
  

  

You're comfortable designing and building GCP architectures, understanding networking, security and containerisation concepts, and working with Infrastructure as Code. You will be able to read and debug code in at least one of the following languages: Python, Golang, Java or HCL. You can manage customer interactions and work effectively with diverse team members. Bonus points if you have experience of migrating from on-premises environments and alternative cloud providers to GCP. Fluency in English is required.


  
- Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?



	* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
	* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
	* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
	* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
	* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.*"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.*

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn
  

  

**Benefits**


	* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
	* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
	* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
	* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
	* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
	* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
	* A modern office in central Stockholm.
	* Full provision of work tools.
	* A variety of social events.Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.
  

  

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check out our Instagram page .
  

  

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior Cloud Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!
  

  

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

title: Account Manager till Online Partner
description:
**Väx med oss!**  

Online Partner erbjuder expertis inom Googles molnbaserade lösningar som hjälper organisationer och individer att växa och uppnå drömmar och mål. Vi erbjuder en helhetssyn kring effektivisering av processer, samarbete, kommunikation och produktivitet i organisationer som använder Googles molntjänster.

**Nordens ledande Googlespecialister**  

Sedan 2010 är vi en certifierad partner till Google och har hjälpt över 3 000+ kunder att bli framgångsrika användare av Googles produkter. Våra medarbetare utbildas och certifieras kontinuerligt i samarbete med Google för att upprätthålla högsta kompetensnivå och alltid leverera högsta kvalitet.


Vi hjälper våra kunder dagligen med bland annat ChromeOS, Google Workspace, Google Cloud Platform, Chromebooks och verktyg för digitala möten. Vi hjälper även företag och organisationer att förflytta sig från andra lösningar till Google Cloud.


Vårt team i Sverige utökas nu med ytterligare en säljresurs. Vi har Google specialistexpertis på plats som tillsammans med dig kommer att utöka vår verksamhet. Vår målgrupp består av privata företag och offentlig sektor. I säljteamet arbetar vi tillsammans för att hjälpa våra kunder på bästa sätt och uppnå våra mål.

**Rollen**  

Som Account Manager bygger du upp din egen kundbas som du utvecklar och utökar över tid för att skapa djupare och långvariga relationer. Det innebär uppsökande av främst nya kunder, men även hantering av befintliga kunder. Du bemöter potentiella kunder över hela landet och riktar dig till både medelstora och stora företag inom olika, relevanta branscher. Du arbetar med en produktportfölj bestående av både Google-produkter och Online Partners egenutvecklade produkter/tjänster och har fullt ansvar för hela säljprocessen från start till mål.


Du kommer att identifiera och följa upp potentiella leads via telefon, onlinemöten eller andra kanaler. Du kommer sedan att kommunicera produktportföljen och boka kundmöten och driva säljprocessen till avslut. Till din hjälp har du vår marknadsavdelning som stöttar, planerar och tillsammans med dig genomför marknadsföringsaktiviteter och kampanjer.


Du kommer även att underhålla vår kunddatabas (CRM), beställa och koordinera säljinriktade marknadsföringskampanjer samt representera Online Partner vid marknadsföringsevent, till exempel mässor.

 **Kvalifikationer:**

* Erfarenhet av produkt- och/eller tjänsteförsäljning till stora och medelstora företag och organisationer, minst 5 år.
* Du har en allmän utbildning inom IT utan att nödvändigtvis ha fördjupade kunskaper.
* Du har erfarenhet av lösningsförsäljning.
* Du är social, strukturerad, kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad.
* Du trivs i en miljö som präglas av högt tempo och glad atmosfär.

**Språkkunskaper:** Flytande svenska och engelska i text och tal.

 **Tillträde:** Så snart som möjligt, efter överenskommelse.

**Plats:** Liljeholmen, Stockholm.

**Omfattning:** Heltid.

 **-**

 *Till bemannings- samt rekryteringsföretag tackar vi vänligt men bestämt* ***nej!***

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
We are Sinch. Join us and be a part of a global leader in Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. With presence across 60 countries, we empower businesses to reach everyone in the world, in seconds or less, through mobile messaging, email, voice, and video.
   

  

 Dream big with us. We believe equal opportunities are the key to our success, no matter who you are, you'll be able to explore career options, take on captivating challenges, and build your skills alongside outstanding people.
   

  

 Sinch Operator Software & Services creates software products for mobile operator network infrastructure and services, providing efficient and scalable solutions for messaging, charging & policy control, revenue assurance and fraud prevention. These products form the foundation for many of Sinch's offerings but are also sold to and used by many of the major mobile network operators as stand-alone products.
   

  

****The essence of the role****
 Join our Operator Software & Service team as our Senior Engineering Manager in Stockholm. In this role, you'll be a crucial part of our engineering organization, focusing primarily on supporting your team members in their career development, recruiting new talent, organizing activities to boost retention, and fostering an environment where teams and individuals can thrive, while being accountable for delivering results.
   

  

 You will lead highly experienced software product teams that develop Sinch telecom products for messaging, charging and policy control.
   

  

**As Our Senior Engineering Manager, You Will**
* Lead team staffing and recruitment, capacity planning, onboarding, offboarding, and coordinating promotions.
* Collaborate with tech and product leadership to ensure your team have the right tools, skills, and processes.
* Facilitate discussions, encourage embracing change, and foster open communication to resolve conflicts.
* Support individual team members in career development, mentoring them to become our future leaders, and promoting cross-training to enhance team resilience.
* Provide insights into team performance and stakeholder perception, particularly management and business stakeholders.
* Maintain awareness of team-stakeholder relationships, addressing any issues impacting collaboration.
* Actively work with employee engagement data to create motivated teams.


****Who you are:****
 Innovation and automation are your passion, and you'll promote and support these initiatives, fostering a healthy, collaborative engineering culture that aligns with our values.
   

  

**To Contribute To This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Degree in Engineering or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Leader with extensive experience of developing and delivering mission critical software products.
* Humble and open leadership style empowers and inspires engineers to grow.
* Excel at setting team targets, establishing effective workflows, follow-up on deliveries, and developing performance on both team and individual level.
* You possess impressive communication skills.


**What Makes You Stand Out**
* Telecom experience.
* Experience from traditional Java/VM based systems and the transition to Cloud Native.


****Are you ready? Join us on our journey!****
 We will review applications continuously and may un-post the ad sooner rather than later depending on the inflow of candidates, so please submit your resume
 **as soon as possible in English.**
**About The Recruitment Process**
 To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. We follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, experience and attributes relevant to the role and Sinch will be assessed. As part of our recruitment process, pre-employment testing is used to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role. We acknowledge that there are two parties making a decision in this process and welcome you to ask any questions you may have at any stage of the process.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Lead
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**We are looking for a Cloud Platform Lead to help us in scaling both our infrastructure and tooling to support more users and our growing product engineering organization.**
**What You'll Do**
 As a Cloud Platform Lead at Mentimeter, you will be a hands-on engineer as well as a technical lead of our Platform team, a team responsible for enabling product teams by providing a highly available, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure platform.
   

  

 You will hold an influential position within the engineering organization, actively participating in technology choices and shaping our platform. Your team's work will empower our product teams to run their code in a scalable and secure manner. This will also mean close collaboration with our Staff Engineers to ensure we set our engineering department up for success. Your team’s decisions will greatly impact Mentimeter’s success, our engineers’ productivity, and developers’ experience as well as .
   

  

 In this role, you will tackle complex technical challenges related to scalability, performance, reliability, and security, while also iterating on building a robust monitoring system for our production environments. You will work extensively with AWS, Terraform, DataDog, and infrastructure. Some days you will focus on managing incidents and conducting post-mortems, while other days will involve engaging with different teams to understand their requirements and develop technical solutions. You will be thinking ahead to build for the future in order to support the exponential growth of our company. A key part of your role will also be formulating the Platform team’s technical strategy and long-term plans.
   

  

 Technologies that you’ll be exposed to include AWS, Terraform, cdktf, Ruby, Typescript, Cloudflare and Datadog.
   

  

**Skills & Requirements**
**Who you are**
 You will have several years of experience as a developer with strong software development skills. We believe you have in-depth experience with cloud architectures and specifically AWS. You should also be proficient in Terraform for infrastructure as code, promoting best practices and efficiency. An interest in reliability and observability is a plus.
   

  

 You have a keen interest in cloud technologies and improving engineering experience together with your team. Maybe you are an informal or formal tech lead today, with experience in suggesting or driving improvements and new ways of working in the team and organization. You need to be interested in teamwork, problem-solving, being a good communicator, and evangelizing the solutions your team implements.
   

  

 Lastly, you should be interested in the opportunity to work in an international environment with 50 different nationalities, where there are lots of learning opportunities and room to grow.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Enterprise Support Manager, ES - EMEA - ISV - Nordics
description:
**Description**
 As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we are in need of high-powered technical leaders to help Amazon’s largest and most strategically important customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud computing. You will work with our top-tier customers, supporting the software development life-cycle for cloud services, operations management of active services, and business relationships with AWS.
   

  

 In this role, you will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mind-share and broad use of Amazon Web Services with one of our largest customers. You must possess management and customer-facing skills that enable you to represent AWS well within a customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers take advantage of the efficiencies, cost savings and quick innovation available only in the cloud.
   

  

 As Enterprise Support Manager, you will lead a team of Technical Account Managers who are the primary operational point of contact for your customer, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business critical applications. You will leverage your broad experience to work closely with sales leadership to plan and ensure successful launch and operations of AWS’s largest application workloads. You will lead operations reviews, both internally and with your customers, while constantly seeking ways to improve your customer’s AWS experience. In this role, you will also act as the voice of the customer within AWS to escalate problems and to drive prioritization of business needs for our customers.
   

  

 Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
   

  

* Champion and advocate for Enterprise customers within Amazon Web Services (be their voice)
* Develop the team responsible for solving technical issues and working directly with AWS engineers to ensure that customer issues are resolved as expediently as possible
* Participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud
* Help Enterprise customers define IT and business processes that work well with cloud deployments
* Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans
* Work with AWS executive leadership to influence the product roadmap
* Provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, detailed pre-launch planning


 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
   

  

* Champion and advocate for Enterprise customers within Amazon Web Services (be their voice)
* Develop the team responsible for solving technical issues and working directly with AWS engineers to ensure that customer issues are resolved as expediently as possible
* Participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud
* Help Enterprise customers define IT and business processes that work well with cloud deployments
* Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans
* Work with AWS executive leadership to influence the product roadmap
* Provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, detailed pre-launch planning


**About The Team**
 About AWS
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Ability to analyze and present operational reviews to customer leadership
* Experience leading technical teams
* Extensive experience in direct customer engagement, with a focus on support to senior executives (Vice President and C-level)
* Have a track record of effectively leading technical teams
* English/Swedish language skills


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience scaling an organization through rapid growth or expansion
* Previous experience in technical account management, business relationship management or consulting
* An adaptable communication style that can fit diverse audiences (with varying technical backgrounds)
* Proficient in communicating complex ideas, either with the written word or in presentations
* Excellent analytical skills with a track record of achieving balance in innovative thinking with a strong customer and quality focus
* A degree in an STEM field is a plus; an MBA is a big plus
* Experience with AWS service offerings


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
